page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The first inhabitants in Eastnor area were ancient Druid dwellers who lived on Midsummer Hill and worshipped the sun. The village itself has always been owned and built by members of the Somers_Cocks family. The present post office was once a black smith and about the middle of the 19th century it was moved to its present position near the church.At the same time the road was rebuilt because it once went past the church on the way to Ledbury. In the Middle ages the Malvern Hills were a chase.The Bishop of Hereford had deer on the west and The Earl of Warwick had deer on the east side of the hills.The Bishop of Hereford complained that the Earl stole his deer and vice_versa!
